subject: MockObjects/JDBC: I don't have to call executeUpdate()
msgSnippet: Everyone: Is it my imagination or is there nothing in the MockPreparedStatement that I can use in my test that forces me to invoke executeUpdate() or
messageBody:
Everyone:

Is it my imagination or is there nothing in the MockPreparedStatement
that I can use in my test that forces me to invoke executeUpdate() or
executeQuery() on the corresponding statement in my production code?

There used to be setExpectedExecuteCalls() but that appears not to be in
v0.09, though it's in the tutorial.

Anyone?

I'm only forced to invoke it when I refactor!
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
